title: Why does the universe exist?
summary: The universe exists because matter and antimatter are not good friends.

title: Research misconduct: how the scientific community is fighting back
summary:
Nature, Published online: 08 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02877-0

Misconduct is rare in science, but there are worries about a detritus of fake papers in the scientific literature. In this podcast, we explore why misco…
body: Nature, Published online: 08 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02877-0 Misconduct is rare in science, but there are worries about a detritus of fake papers in the scientific literature. In this podcast, we explore why misconduct happens and how to tackle it.

title: ‘Communities already have the solutions’: why I advocate for Indigenous knowledge
summary:
Nature, Published online: 08 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02654-z

Environmental scientist and global advocate Jessica Hernandez works to secure women’s rights and to integrate Indigenous science into environmental poli…
body: Nature, Published online: 08 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02654-z Environmental scientist and global advocate Jessica Hernandez works to secure women’s rights and to integrate Indigenous science into environmental policy.

title: The New Math of Quantum Cryptography
summary: In theory, quantum physics can bypass the hard mathematical problems at the root of modern encryption. A new proof shows how.

title: Scientific objectivity is a myth — here's why
summary: Cultural ideas are inextricably entwined with the people who do science, the questions they ask, the assumptions they hold and the conclusions they land on.

title: فيديو.. الشرع يحضر حفل تخرج زوجته لطيفة من الجامعة
summary: تداول رواد مواقع التواصل الاجتماعي مقطع فيديو يوثق حضور الرئيس السوري أحمد الشرع حفل تخرج عقيلته لطيفة دروبي من جامعة إدلب كلية الآداب والعلوم الإنسانية.

title: James Webb telescope finds a warped 'Butterfly Star' shedding its chrysalis — Space photo of the week
summary: The James Webb Space Telescope has snapped a new view of a planet-forming disk within the Taurus star-forming region.

title: Do humans and chimps really share nearly 99% of their DNA?
summary: The frequently cited 99% similarity between human and chimp DNA overlooks key differences in the genomes.

title: Are alpha males real?
summary: The term "alpha male" was coined in 1970 to describe wolves. But what does science think about the term now?

title: كسرت الأرقام القياسية.. "طفلة خارقة" تحصد الثانوية الفرنسية
summary: أعلنت وزارة التربية الوطنية الفرنسية، الجمعة، حصول تلميذة في التاسعة من العمر على شهادة البكالوريا في يوليو، لتصبح بذلك أصغر شخص ينال هذه الشهادة، وذلك في تأكيد لمعلومات نشرتها قناة "فرانس إنفو".

title: بعد وفاته.. "حمى أرماني" تجتاح الإنترنت
summary: ازدادت عمليات البحث على الإنترنت عن أزياء قديمة من العلامة التجارية للمصمم الإيطالي الشهير جورجيو أرماني منذ وفاته، الخميس، في الوقت الذي تردد فيه المتسوقون على منافذ بيع الملابس المستعملة للبحث عن تصاميمه.

title: Will the James Webb telescope lead us to alien life? Scientists say we're getting closer than ever.
summary: Three years into its mission, the James Webb Space Telescope has advanced the search for alien life more than any machine before it. What will it find next?

title: Fishers discover first-of-its-kind bright orange shark with two rare conditions in Caribbean
summary: Fishers caught a bright orange shark off Costa Rica that had albinism, alongside the species' first scientifically documented case of an extremely rare condition called xanthism.

title: Narusawa Ice Cave: The lava tube brimming with 10-foot-high ice pillars at the base of Mount Fuji
summary: The Narusawa Ice Cave is a natural lava tunnel that formed during a violent eruption of Mount Fuji in A.D. 864. Every winter, the cave grows giant ice pillars due to its freezing temperatures.

title: Chinese submersible explores previously unknown giant craters at the bottom of the Pacific — and they're teeming with life
summary: Scientists have discovered and explored a giant hydrothermal system at the bottom of the Pacific, which could provide a window into the origins of life on Earth.

title: Skull of bear held captive to fight Roman gladiators discovered near ancient amphitheater in Serbia
summary: Archaeologists determined that the bear had an infected injury and had been held captive for a significant amount of time.

title: Key Atlantic current could start collapsing as early as 2055, new study finds
summary: The Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation brings heat to the Northern Hemisphere and regulates the climate globally, but research suggests it could weaken significantly in the coming decades.

title: 40-year-old 'queen of icebergs' A23a is no longer world's biggest after losing several 'very large chunks' since May
summary: A giant iceberg called A23a that broke off Antarctica in 1986 is now disintegrating near South Georgia Island in the South Atlantic Ocean, scientists say.

title: It’s Possible to Remove the Forever Chemicals in Drinking Water. Will It Happen?
summary: New research shows that filtration systems that remove PFAS can also get rid of other harmful substances. Whether they’ll actually be introduced is a different matter entirely.

title: Iconic winged lion statue in Venice may actually be from China's Tang dynasty, study finds
summary: A new study of the trace amounts of lead in Venice's famous winged lion statue suggests that its metal originated in China — and Marco Polo's family may have brought it over.

title: James Webb telescope discovers 'exceptionally rare' 5-galaxy crash in the early universe
summary: Near-infrared images from the James Webb Space Telescope revealed five early universe galaxies merging within a large halo.

title: Who will see the 'blood moon' total lunar eclipse this weekend?
summary: The full moon on Sept. 7, 2025 will be a "blood moon" total lunar eclipse. Here's who will see the longest total lunar eclipse since 2022.

title: Cas9 senses CRISPR RNA abundance to regulate CRISPR spacer acquisition
summary:
Nature, Published online: 03 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09577-9

Cas9 senses CRISPR RNA abundance to regulate CRISPR spacer acquisition
body: Nature, Published online: 03 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09577-9 Cas9 senses CRISPR RNA abundance to regulate CRISPR spacer acquisition

title: 1.8 million-year-old human jawbone discovered in Republic of Georgia — and it may be earliest evidence yet of Homo erectus
summary: A new fossil find in the Republic of Georgia is expanding our understanding of the earliest humans to leave Africa.

title: بالفيديو.. أنغام تفاجئ جمهور مهرجان العلمين
summary: فاجأت النجمة المصرية أنغام الجمهور بحضورها حفل فرقة "كايروكي" في مهرجان العلمين، في أول ظهور علني في حفل غنائي بعد رحلة علاج بالخارج.
